channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: More than 10% of Congress won't return to their seats after 2026
item.description: NPR is tracking the record number of congressional lawmakers – now more than one in ten current members – who have announced plans to retire or run fo...

item.title: Trump's economic approval at new low. And, Congress set to let ACA subsidies expire
item.description: A new NPR poll finds that President Trump's economic approval has hit a new low at 36%. And, Congress has two days to take action on health care subsi...

item.title: GOP House Rep. says it's 'unacceptable' to allow ACA subsidies to expire
item.description: Rep. Mike Lawler says House Speaker Mike Johnson is correct in saying the health care system isn't working, but allowing ACA subsidies to expire witho...

item.title: Greetings from Chiloé Island, Chile, where the fast-moving tides are part of local lore
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.

item.title: Trump's BBC lawsuit: A botched report, BritBox, and porn
item.description: President Trump's lawsuit alleges that the BBC's fall 2024 documentary was "a brazen attempt" to harm his re-election. The BBC has apologized but reje...

item.title: Walmart impersonation scam targets hundreds of thousands each week
item.description: Scammers pretending to be Walmart employees are preying on consumers, according to the FCC. Here's what to watch out for.

item.title: Starmer tells Abramovich to 'pay up now' or face court
item.description: The Prime Minister said Roman Abramovich should make good on his pledge that money from the sale of Chelsea FC would go to benefit Ukrainians

item.title: Venezuela denounces Trump's order for ship blockade as 'warmongering threats'
item.description: It comes a week after the US seized an oil tanker off the country's coast, intensifying pressure on Nicolás Maduro.

item.title: Warner Bros favours Netflix offer over $108bn Paramount bid
item.description: Warner Brothers says the offer for its film and streaming businesses is inferior to Netflix's.

item.title: GOP lawmakers join Democrats to force vote on extending health care subsidies
item.description: A group of moderate Republicans signed a petition to force a House vote on extending health care tax credits for three years, a major blow to Speaker ...

item.title: Louvre Museum partially reopens despite workers voting to extend strike
item.description: Paris' Louvre Museum partially reopened Wednesday despite workers voting to extend a strike that began Monday. CBS News' Haley Ott has the latest.

item.title: Nick Reiner charged with murder of his parents Rob and Michele
item.description: Rob Reiner, the Hollywood director, and his wife Michele were both found dead with stab wounds on Sunday.

item.title: DOJ investigating more than a dozen cases of sexual harassment by landlords
item.description: The Justice Department is suing more than a dozen landlords on allegations of sexual harassment, a problem one top department official called "traumat...

item.title: Investigators release additional video of possible Brown gunman as search continues
item.description: Authorities are asking the public for any footage they might have of the gunman who fatally shot two students and wounded nine others at Brown Univers...

item.title: Brown shooting investigators release "enhanced" footage of person of interest
item.description: In several zoomed-in videos police say were captured on the East Side of Providence approximately two hours before the shooting, the person of interes...

item.title: Nato spending pledge is Trump's biggest foreign policy success, Rutte tells BBC
item.description: The Nato chief said it was thanks to Donald Trump that the alliance is "stronger than it ever was".

item.title: Brown mourns the loss of an aspiring doctor and campus leader to the campus attack
Brown University shooting leaves students, community frustrated with official response
